data.title: The 50+ Best Oliver Platt Movies & TV Shows
data.meta_description: Over 100 fans have voted on the 50+ Best Oliver Platt Movies & TV Shows. Current Top 3: The Three Musketeers, A Time to Kill, Lake Placid
data.text:
Ranked By

908 votes

139 voters

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies and TV shows, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

List of the best Oliver Platt movies and TV shows, ranked best to worst. Oliver Platt's highest grossing movies and TV shows have received a lot of accolades over the years, earning millions upon millions around the world. The order of these top Oliver Platt movies and shows are decided by how many votes they receive, so only highly rated Oliver Platt movies and shows will be at the top of the list. Oliver Platt has been in a lot of films and shows, so people often debate each other over his greatest role of all time is. If you and a friend are arguing about this then use this list of the most entertaining Oliver Platt films and shows to end the squabble once and for all.

If you think the best Oliver Platt role isn't at the top, then upvote it so it has the chance to become number one. The greatest Oliver Platt performances didn't necessarily come from the best movies and shows, but in most cases they go hand in hand.

Examples of films on this list include Flatliners and Dr. Dolittle.

This list answers the questions, "What are the best Oliver Platt movies and TV shows?" and "What are the greatest Oliver Platt roles of all time?"

Ron Howard and Joel Schumacher are among those who have directed Oliver Platt at one point or another during their careers in the film industry. Is Oliver Platt your favorite person to watch on the big screen? You might also want to vote on our best Peter Boyle and Kevin Pollak films lists too.

Latest additions: Babes

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best Oliver Platt Movies & TV Shows

Actors : Charlie Sheen, Kiefer Sutherland, Chris O'Donnell, Oliver Platt, Tim Curry

Released : 1993

Directed by : Stephen Herek

In The Three Musketeers, young and impetuous D'Artagnan (Chris O'Donnell) joins forces with the legendary trio of Musketeers - Athos (Kiefer Sutherland), Porthos (Oliver Platt), and Aramis (Charlie Sheen). Together, they navigate political intrigues and plots, aiming to thwart the devious Cardinal Richelieu (Tim Curry) and protect France's crown.

Actors : Sandra Bullock, Samuel L. Jackson, Matthew McConaughey, Kevin Spacey, Brenda Fricker

Released : 1996

Directed by : Joel Schumacher

In the heart of Mississippi, A Time to Kill unfolds, a legal drama with a backdrop of racial tension. Young attorney Jake Brigance (Matthew McConaughey) takes on a daunting case defending Carl Lee Hailey (Samuel L. Jackson), a black man accused of taking law into his own hands after an unspeakable crime against his daughter. With Ellen Roark (Sandra Bullock) offering her help, they navigate the deeply divided town. The movie, directed by Joel Schumacher, is an adaptation of John Grisham's first novel and won Samuel L. Jackson the Best Actor award at the NAACP Image Awards.

Actors : Bill Pullman, Bridget Fonda, Oliver Platt, Brendan Gleeson, Betty White

Released : 1999

Directed by : Steve Miner

In the suspenseful horror-comedy Lake Placid, tranquil Black Lake, Maine becomes a nightmare when a giant, man-eating crocodile takes residence. Local sheriff Hank Keough (Brendan Gleeson), fish and game warden Jack Wells (Bill Pullman), and paleontologist Kelly Scott (Bridget Fonda) are left to confront this monstrous beast. They're joined by Hector Cyr (Oliver Platt), a flamboyant mythology professor who adds an eccentric touch to their desperate quest. As they unravel the mystery behind the crocodile's unlikely presence, their mission becomes increasingly perilous. A blend of thrills and laughs, Lake Placid delivers an unexpected twist on typical creature-feature narratives.

4

Actors : Kiefer Sutherland, Julia Roberts, Kevin Bacon, William Baldwin, Oliver Platt

Released : 1990

Directed by : Joel Schumacher

Flatliners, a gripping thriller, explores the daring exploits of five medical students led by Nelson Wright (Kiefer Sutherland). Under his influence, they begin conducting clandestine experiments that produce near-death experiences. Among them, Rachel Mannus (Julia Roberts) and David Labraccio (Kevin Bacon) stand out as key players in this dangerous game. The group's curiosity about life after death spirals into chaos as they are each haunted by physical manifestations of their childhood sins. These eerie consequences force them to confront the line between life and death, testing their sanity and scientific ethics.

Actors : James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, January Jones

Released : 2011

Directed by : Matthew Vaughn

X-Men: First Class, a vivid tapestry of action and drama, unspools the genesis of the X-Men saga. In this robust prequel, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and Erik Lehnsherr (Michael Fassbender), who are yet to become Professor X and Magneto respectively, join forces against the dire threat posed by Sebastian Shaw (Kevin Bacon). Set against the backdrop of the Cold War, it showcases their transformation from close friends into bitter adversaries. The film, interspersed with thrilling sequences and notable performances, won accolades for its narrative depth and visual effects. It's an intriguing exploration of loyalty, ideology, and origin, leading up to the birth of two conflicting factions in the mutant world.

Actors : Johnny Depp, Mary Stuart Masterson, Aidan Quinn, Julianne Moore, Oliver Platt

Released : 1993

Directed by : Jeremiah S. Chechik

Benny (Aidan Quinn), who cares for his mentally disturbed sister, Joon (Mary Stuart Masterson), also welcomes the eccentric Sam (Johnny Depp) into his home at Joon's request. Sam entertains Joon while he dreams of a job at the video store. Once Benny realizes Joon and Sam have started a relationship, he kicks Sam out of the house. This leads to an altercation between brother and sister. Joon runs away with Sam, who soon realizes that she may need more support than he alone can provide.
